item.title: Exercise and longevity (Gremeaux et al. 2012)
item.description: This paper was written by the Cardiovascular Prevention and Rehabilitation Center (Centre ÉPIC) in Montreal, Canada, in collaboration with CHU Poitiers, CHU Dijon and the University of Poitiers in France. Longevity, the ability to reach an age above average, is influenced by intrinsic (genetic) and extrinsic factors (lifestyle, nutrition, mental and physical wellbeing). In this paper, the authors suggest there is a correlation between exercise and reduction in risks for cardiovascular diseases, various forms of cancer and decaying in muscles and the skeleton; moreover, such correlation may be proportional to the exercise volume (duration x intensity).

item.title: About
item.description: "A mind is a parachute, it doesn't work if you don't open it". E-mail Resumé Linkedin Github I graduated in Computer Science in 2021 at the University of Parma, Italy. I am junior software engineer and my current focus is Deep Learning: Self Supervised Learning Multi-modal learning Language models Reinforcement Learning I am also interested in life-long investing, longevity, sociology and visual arts.
